message.content:
cs.GT, cs.DC, cs.CE, cs.CR, cs.DS 

The paper proposes a formal model of utility and social welfare for Bitcoin mining, which suggests that it belongs to the Game Theory (cs.GT) and Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the optimization of pooling strategies, which could fall under the Computation and Language (cs.CL) and Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-categories. Finally, the paper mentions the application of the results to other forms of pooled mining or crowdsourcing computations, which could relate to the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category.
